result_0:
<?php

/**
 * This function determines whether it is possible to perform an exchange of elements
 * between two lists to make the first list a list of only even numbers.
 *
 * @param array $lst1 The list that needs to be made of only even numbers.
 * @param array $lst2 The list from which elements can be exchanged with lst1.
 *
 * @return string "YES" if it is possible to exchange elements between the lists
 *                to make all the elements of lst1 to be even, otherwise "NO".
 */
function exchange($lst1, $lst2){
    // Create a set of odd numbers in lst1 for efficient lookups
    $oddInLst1 = array_filter($lst1, function($num) {
        return $num % 2 != 0;
    });

    // Iterate over the elements in lst2
    foreach ($lst2 as $num) {
        // If the current number is odd and it's not already in the set of odd numbers in lst1,
        // add it to the set and remove its corresponding element from lst1
        if ($num % 2 != 0 && !in_array($num, $oddInLst1)) {
            $oddInLst1[] = $num;
            unset($lst1[array_search($num, $lst1)]);
        }
    }

    // If all elements in lst1 are even after the exchanges, return "YES"
    if (empty($oddInLst1)) {
        return "YES";
    } else {
        return "NO";
    }
}

// Test cases
print(exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 2, 3, 4]) . "
"); // Output: YES
print(exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 5, 3, 4]) . "
"); // Output: NO

result_1:
<?php

/**
 * This function determines whether it is possible to perform an exchange of elements
 * between two lists to make the first list a list of only even numbers.
 *
 * @param array $lst1 The list that needs to be made of only even numbers.
 * @param array $lst2 The list from which elements can be exchanged with lst1.
 *
 * @return string "YES" if it is possible to exchange elements between the lists
 *                to make all the elements of lst1 to be even, otherwise "NO".
 */
function exchange($lst1, $lst2){
    // Create a set of odd numbers from lst1 for efficient lookups
    $oddNumbers = array_filter($lst1, function($num) {
        return $num % 2 != 0;
    });

    // Iterate over each number in lst1
    foreach ($lst1 as $index => $num) {
        // If the current number is even, continue to the next one
        if ($num % 2 == 0) {
            continue;
        }

        // Find an odd number in lst2 that can be exchanged with the current number in lst1
        foreach ($lst2 as $index => $oddNum) {
            if ($oddNum % 2 != 0 && $oddNum < $num) {
                // Swap the numbers in both lists
                list($num, $oddNum) = array($oddNum, $num);
                break;
            }
        }

        // If no odd number was found in lst2 that can be exchanged with the current number in lst1,
        // return "NO"
        if ($num % 2 != 0) {
            return "NO";
        }
    }

    // If all numbers in lst1 have been made even, return "YES"
    return "YES";
}

// Test cases
print(exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 2, 3, 4]) . "
"); // "YES"
print(exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 5, 3, 4]) . "
"); // "NO"

<?php

/**
 * This function determines whether it is possible to perform an exchange of elements
 * between two lists to make the first list a list of only even numbers.
 *
 * @param array $lst1 The list that needs to be made of only even numbers.
 * @param array $lst2 The list from which elements can be exchanged with lst1.
 *
 * @return string "YES" if it is possible to exchange elements between the lists
 *                to make all the elements of lst1 to be even, otherwise "NO".
 */
function exchange($lst1, $lst2){
    // Create a set of odd numbers from lst1 for efficient lookups
    $oddNumbers = array_filter($lst1, function($num) {
        return $num % 2 != 0;
    });

    // Iterate over the elements in lst2
    foreach ($lst2 as $num) {
        // If the current number is odd and not already in the set of odd numbers,
        // add it to the set and remove its corresponding element from lst1
        if ($num % 2 != 0 && !in_array($num, $oddNumbers)) {
            $oddNumbers[] = $num;
            unset($lst1[array_search($num, $lst1)]);
        }
    }

    // If all elements in lst1 are even after the exchanges, return "YES"
    if (empty(array_filter($lst1, function($num) {
        return $num % 2 != 0;
    }))) {
        return "YES";
    } else {
        return "NO";
    }
}

// Test cases
print(exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 2, 3, 4]) . "
"); // "YES"
print(exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 5, 3, 4]) . "
"); // "NO"

<?php

/**
 * This function determines whether it is possible to perform an exchange of elements
 * between two lists to make the first list a list of only even numbers.
 *
 * @param array $lst1 The list that needs to be made of only even numbers.
 * @param array $lst2 The list from which elements can be exchanged with lst1.
 *
 * @return string "YES" if it is possible to exchange elements between the lists
 *                to make all the elements of lst1 to be even, otherwise "NO".
 */
function exchange($lst1, $lst2){
    // Create a set of odd numbers from lst1 for efficient lookups
    $oddNumbers = array_filter($lst1, function($num) {
        return $num % 2 != 0;
    });

    // Iterate over the elements in lst2
    foreach ($lst2 as $num) {
        // If the current number is odd and it's not already in the set of odd numbers,
        // add it to the set and remove its corresponding element from lst1
        if ($num % 2 != 0 && !in_array($num, $oddNumbers)) {
            $oddNumbers[] = $num;
            unset($lst1[array_search($num, $lst1)]);
        }
    }

    // If all elements in lst1 are even, return "YES", otherwise return "NO"
    return empty($lst1) ? "YES" : "NO";
}

// Test cases
print(exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 2, 3, 4]) . "
"); // "YES"
print(exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 5, 3, 4]) . "
"); // "NO"
